name: Paul Matavire
description: '''Paul Matavire''' was a blind Zimbabwean musician and songwriter born in [[Maranda, Zimbabwe|Maranda]], [[Mwenezi District]]. He rose to prominence in the 1980s when he joined the Jairos Jiri Band based in [[Bulawayo]] at the Jairos Jiri Rehabilitation Centre. He was then elected to lead the Jairo Jiri Band, as one of Zimbabwe's finest musicians to emerge after the country gained independence from Britain in 1980. He died at the age of 44, in 2005, at his farm in [[Rutenga]], [[Masvingo]]. By the time of his death, he is believed{{By whom|date=March 2015}} to have been an owner of a large herd of cattle, having spent the last days of his life as a farmer.
